data.title: Poetry from the Innermost Parts
data.meta_description: This is a collection of prayers and poems I write weekly(usually for the occasion of meditation on the Sabbath rest of the Lord) and share with loved ones. I decided to share them here in the hope that they will bless you and give honor to my King. I have exposed my heart and soul…
data.text:
My Muse

February 17, 2023

November 4,2022

he let me wear his sweater

after I yelled and called him names, told him nothing feels the same

he let me wear his sweater

when I shook, when I cried, when I couldn’t even look him in the eye

he let me wear his sweater

as I sweat and I trembled, tried to stand only to -once again- fall, breath so foul it could peel paper off walls

he pushed up the long sleeve… of this sweater he draped around me

to hold a once contorted fist

to even give it a gentle kiss

why have I been so blind

so mean

so shameful and burdensome

a liability instead of a blessing

he showed me what

blessing

means

when he let me wear his sweater…

anyway.

November 4, 2022

are we?

dancing embers round the fire

how they shimmer and ascend

to sparking orange then to ash transcend

once they make their hasty flight

they’re gone- they end

they disappear

lifespan brief and fleeting

if lovely and transfixing

no, this isn’t you and me

are we?

scooping diving

rising colliding

passionate

undulating

red hot flames?

They kiss and waltz

without shame or hindrance tickling the sky’s vault

they warm the darkest night…

a little closer perhaps

but still not quite

We are deeper red

once the spark and the flame have subsided

we collect close together in a snug peaceful mound

throbbing, lasting, still warming all close enough

to stick around

long enough to watch us remain

despite the torrent and crash of the fire

long after the temporary wink of the spark…

aren’t we that which stays huddled, burning slow

patiently, even re-igniting one another with that

faithful coal’s glow

(P.S. we make the best marshmallow’s ;] )

July 5, 2022

There’s nothing you can do

To take it away

I may want to make it go away

But love won’t let it go away

Hours in the light

Nothing happening

Just life

Peace

Without criticism

From within or

out of my mind

Just golden and black butterflies

As big as my palm

Flying with intention

In a miniature swarm

Just shifting sand particles

Between the toes of my babes

With nothing needing from me

For I have nothing to proclaim

Just hope when I look upon how

The water rose

The sand so that our perch for prayers

Is a more accessible throne

We come here

This is cathedral

This is stained glass without the windows

This is squirrels dancing biting leaves

This is clouds as soft as pillows

There’s nothing you can do

To take it away

Let the slings and arrows of the enemy

Not cause me to betray

The stones in my satchel

They are smooth and they are fierce

They aren’t meant to inflict pain

Only there to evade tears

Love won’t let it go away

Abandon

Laughter

Confidence

This chapter… won’t be for naught

May 8, 2022

Mother knows

Bodily sacrifice

Pain and change

When things no longer

Look or fit just right

Morphing your form

To grow a child inside

Mother knows

What that is like

Mother knows

The incredible pain

That is instantly forgotten

Once she has gained

A life that will ever be

A part of her

A near death experience

In exchange for

Indescribable pleasure

Mother knows

Of this for sure

Mother knows

Stillness in the night

After days of sleeplessness

And trying to find

The way to become

What no one else can provide

For this child

Your calling

And purpose in life

Rocking softly

For the both of us,

synching our insides

Mother knows

All about these nights

Mother knows

Watching you grow

Clumsily grasping hours

That shift into years

Filled with anxiety and memory

Blessing and tears

Paying attention

When no one else cares

Obtaining the materials for

You to paint your dreams

Mother knows

Just how to provide these things

Mother knows

When you need to be held

When you need to be heard

When you need to be felt

She also knows when you need

A start

A wake up call,

A check on your heart

She’ll be your adversary

If she can sacrifice to shield your pain

She’ll be your companion

When the tears fall like rain

Perceiving when to speak

And when to flee

Mother knows

When we don’t know what we need

Mother knows

When she’s gone it won’t be the same

Knows what to write in that letter

That will speak despite her absence

So she crafts moments

Designing advice that remains

permanently

She’s always teaching

Always leading

Serving, selflessly

Even if no one acknowledges

Or gives her credit now

Mother knows well

You, are the great ‘pay out’

Mother knows

What love is

No matter what is said

Its eye contact in trauma

Its an unexpected hug

Its unsolicited service

Its getting down to play with you on the rug

Love in life is elusive

But never with this one

No flip flops

No dancing between opinions

No she’s your advocate

So you’ve won

Something irreplaceable

That will never fade completely away

Mother knows about this

And so honor each one this day

______________

It is the hardest and best job in the entire world!

I wouldn’t trade the time I have with these children for all the status or money or adventure in all the world.

And the women who have shaped my life, I would not… exist without them- not just because of physical truth but because of spiritual nourishment and provision.

Each of you is precious and of highest value, you’ve been given a task only you can do.

If no one else acknowledges your efforts today…

I pray that this token will bless you.

Happy Mothers day!

April 22, 2022

—-I Know One ———

Two days later what do I say

I scrolled down from that negative

desperate page

Sure the words were truth

But the feelings were rage

and nothing good comes

from sharing such pain

With room to breathe and time to think

I feel my body coming back to me

My mind, never stops it seems, but its’ mastery

is an entirely different thing

So in the moments I allow

myself to look and feel and be in the now

The now of that thought or memory

So often I feel – failed, defeat…

When I hide inside myself

and put my roots down in my mattress

I can pretend that all these things never really happened

But they did, and there is always a consequence

For better or for worse

For life or for death

I’ve weeded my deathbed

and put my feet on the ground

My heart like a ‘field newly plowed’

I’ve cleaned out my ears,

And opened up the curtains

let the light in, even if it exposes the dirt herein

Yes the dirt herein is hard to breathe near

Sometimes I choke, and put a mask over my fear

Sometimes I feel like a phony, do I really feel that which I proclaim?

Sometimes I have to pretend… to be ok.

But as the sun, the dust, and distant giggles trickle in…

My heart skips a beat, but this time not

because something is wrong

It’s a song… a sweet recognizable song

And my youngest treasure is going over and over the same refrain …

“Echad Mi Yodeah!” ( “I Know One”)

Salvation is His Name

If I thought everything I fought for and scrubbed and sown

would all be surrendered and sullied and undone

If I believed I’d wrapped the entire Feast up in a garbage sack

and drug it to the pyre…meanwhile breaking my back

Crippled and incoherent, illegible and soiled

Turns out that which had the true meaning… was absorbed

and will last

It will last as long is it remains preserved

Long as I don’t give up

Long as I truly drink in the lessons learned

What’s the proof of that?

Well I suppose it will be when the axe is swung

I won’t scream in despair, instead… I’ll duck

I suppose the proof will come

When the stones are thrown…

I won’t stay crumbled in a lump,

but instead take hold of the hand Who lifts me up

I guess that when the lashes fly ‘tearing flesh from bone’

And rendering what took so much, was so hard to keep strong

Into a pile of goo to be trampled on…

I won’t add poison to that concoction of trauma

And instead imbibe the healing living waters of

what it really means to take hold of the Torah

Tonight as we celebrate rest and get a glimpse

Of the eternal Shabbat I pray someday to experience

We also recall walking through the waters’ walls

Out of Egypt, but there were still many pitfalls

What state am I in walking through?

Negative, desperate, filled with rage and pain?

Or finally, finally, taking control of my mind and body

Living in the now instead of regretting the failed, defeated days…

Am I planted in my bed and filth, or

Tilling up rotten old practices and habits and sowing for new growth?

Am I hanging darkness over the broad day sun coming through,

Or opening wide the phony excuses so that healing can take root…

As the spray of salt water and the rush of east wind kisses my face

I take off the mask so I can breathe freely all that will take place

We’re still singing the songs we sang from beneath the Lamb’s blood

When the Defender passed over the threshold to protect His beloved

Sometimes I look around

And have no idea what is going on

Sometimes I feel like everything is going horrifically wrong

“I Know One”… I still can sing the words to that song

When there’s war, and murder…

Not only in the world but in our hearts…

Walking in faith through those waters,

Truly is… the first and best place to ‘re-start’

Chag Pesach Sameach!

Shabbat Shalom!

Hashem split the sea, all we had to do was… see the Way.

And what then

what do I do

Everything I’ve been through

shouldn’t it be a testimony about You?

But what if I can’t word it

what if nothing defines

the way You brought me to the edge

to CAUSE me to find

I was missing something

Essential in my life

I was moving onward…

leaving valuables behind

There were times in great darkness

I said, I couldn’t find you any place

I couldn’t see, couldn’t feel, couldn’t

imagine Your presence, Your face

There at the edge I looked over

and said, ok… maybe on to the new dream

Then you gently pushed me forward

holding my weight by a garment with straining seams

There were moments I wished they’d just give

and tear apart allowing me to plummet

times when I wish You’d just finish the job

and push me over the terrifying summit

Instead what transpired

is I found out how strong ties can be

when they are Your chords of love

You encircles, entwined around me

Leaning and dangling

I stopped struggling

and let You shape the story

Knowing somehow, it’d continue, with You crowned

in righteous glory

What I thought was the worst thing to happen

turned out to be a safety net from true disaster

You see the end from the beginning

You knew I wouldn’t fall, my soul’s Master

Rejecting Your correction

blaming the enemy

when it was You there on that cliff side

You were there… pushing, moving me

Yet, keeping me

Once unwound and unraveled the strands

How did I find myself?

Naked and somehow unafraid

because I landed in Your hand

What is the rub?

The bottom line?

Where’s the crux?

The fact of the matter?

The Heart?

If I live for myself

I’ve missed the point…

I don’t need

You’ve given me everything

Do You need me?

If I still breathe…

Then yes.

It’s not about what I can do

I can do nothing at all…

Its about what You’ve put me here to do

And sometimes You take us to the edge

To teach us

How to fall

January 10, 2022

she began to tell me something new

not separate not different but…deeper and true

as she described her impression

of the ceremonial repetition

every hair on the head of my pride stood erect

how could she describe all our moments like this

then a voice from the depths of the sparks in my soul

begged me: Listen, just listen and let

your self go

She spoke of an experience unique to each one

but once having consummated this Union, one knows

what it was

what it was she described with her heart in her hands

was experiencing God

outside of all structured plans

my heart melted as I listened to my daughter confess

it wasn’t at the communal table,

nor the festive moon, nor the shofar, nor the bonfire,

nor the starlit Sukkah

but in moments when she felt Him,

and truly believed in sheer delight

So now I take this moment to truly deeply recognize

something happened

something wondrous

and I almost let it pass me by

Sure, I’ve dedicated

all the deepest parts of me

to building structure

facilitating experience

decorating rooms I’d prayed to fill

with intention

with connection

with a model of chasing after His will

and sure,

I dream about it

Shabbos with my grandchildren

gathered round

the gleaming tender leaves

of my olive shoots

singing gleefully, jubilant, proud

but the truth that she

highlighted

is a veracity each candid soul holds

the most moving lasting moments with God

– are when we are all alone

I wonder if you told me as a test perhaps to see

if I’d diminish your experience and

make it all about me

whatever the purpose I thank you

for extending your thoughtful heart

and I thank You my King for gifting that

oh my daughter… come and see…

this is only the start!

December 17, 2021

And then I eventually settle in at the keyboard

I have not opened my new laptop

That laptop traded for points to “do God’s work”

It was said…

I haven’t opened it in more than a week.

I have not worked on anything.

But I have cried harder than I ever have in my 38 years

I have sat in my closet reading my notes to myself

It was supposed to be a better self looking at those notes

But its not a better self

Its a more honest self

I have had my heart broken open in ways I never thought

Could possibly lead to a blessing

So that is what I am hopeful for

I thought

Honestly I could never be honest about this

Whirlwind, chaotic, unpin down able, un translatable jumble inside

There’s anger, because

I wanted to be happy

Because I tried so hard to be happy

I think someone might look at that and think…

Happy just IS

Anyone who has to TRY to be happy is deformed

That is what I am

Disabled in many ways and deformed …

Because it takes an exerted effort every single day

For me

To try to be cheery, motivated, productive

And when I am not

And when my kid is getting F’s or destroying their room

Or breaking our hearts in a variety of ways

It is not they

But I who FAIL

When I can’t make the pain go away

For my love and I can’t help them get to where they so

Desperately want go, to get to

Where every effort that took the heart of me

Is just not anywhere near enough for them…

I am left with nothing

BUT

You keep going

Because you have no choice in the matter

These lives are far too precious

And as bad of an example as being desperate enough to cry for hours in a ball…

Its far worse of one example to give completely up

I am tired of failing.

Tired of asking for help.

Tired of taking.

Tired of not being who God made me to be.

Tired of starting from square one.

Again. And again. And again. And again.

As I crumbled in His arms…

He showed me what I hadn’t taken into account.

Ok- so you’re really crying, you’ve really come to a place where you’ve allowed yourself to ‘let it all out’…

And now you’re looking at is as despicable?

Because what?

You failed at this goal, or that?…

I guess… you forgot how much you have been carrying.

And maybe, you also forgot or didn’t realize how LONG you’ve been carrying it.

Maybe you didn’t realize the value of what you were holding together…

Because it was a whole lot.

How many times did you put yourself last?

How many times did you forbid yourself to feel, to fail, to cry?

Don’t you see… that I see everything

Everything

Everything you have not.

Each time you glorified Me in your heart

With your life

In your deeds

I know they don’t feel like ‘enough’ now…

But I assure you

Each act of service was NOT a filthy rag before My sight.

So

The question is

Can you live for that?

Knowing that I know.

Knowing that its ok to take a few hours in the closet.

That its ok to take a few days not doing

anything.

Knowing…

That as the puffiness in your eyes recedes

And the clarity in your mind slowly takes root

And the motivation in your soul… yes, takes its place

Sets its feet in the blocks at square one… again

I will be there

As I always have been

Already

Already

Cheering you on.

You’re not going to win.

But you’re going to run.

And keep running.

Because no matter how

Desperate and alone you feel

You are not.

Some people can just be happy.

Your happy… it cost more.

That is perhaps why, when its real

Its so intense

It’s such an offering to Me

And I know, that is all you desire.

So –

How nice is that?

How sweet and kind and loving a God we serve.

What oh what would life be like without Him?

I wouldn’t be here, simple as that.

So now here is what I am choosing

Making a conscious choice to believe:

Every health goal I desire

If it accords with His will

He will provide me the strength and I will get there…

In His time.

Every family goal I long and work for

If it accords with His will

He will move the hearts involved and we will arrive there…

In His time.

Every career or monetary need or goal that exists…

If it accords with His will

He will make happen, and abundantly…

In His time.

Every spiritual undertaking I walk into

If it accords with His will

He will water, and feed, and make to flourish and blossom

In His time.

December 1, 2021

November 30, 2021

Shared with Your friends

Who am I writing this for?

Does anyone who comes to a page to

Pour forth their humanity ever really… know?

Who is listening

Who cares

But more who does this touch?

Because whoever you are… I am you, you are me…

I say that all the time when I teach…

That sounds crazy.

Teach.

That word humbles me.

That is why I have retreated.

I don’t feel worthy of teaching and I am

Duly unworthy.

Because the struggle is…

Am I holy enough to touch it

How dare I handle His words

With unclean hands

But when I hear criticism of the patriarchs or foremothers

It stings

Its a judgment and critique from people

Far removed from their…

Reckonings

Of situations.

We do not know how many

Sleepless nights were spent.

Yet- we look at Sarai and say…

How could you offer forbidden fruit?

Or, holy man… how could you take and eat of it?

I tremble with the weight of my mistakes

I cannot hold them any longer.

So… I fumble around my kitchen to made all the

Expected delicacies

And I cut and paste and …voila… to maybe

And ooh or an awww…

And then

Eventually I wonder

What is it for?

Who is it for?

And then…

My child

My very smart

But very very naive

Two year old child

Randomly,

Without prompt

Without present

Without sweet bribe

Comes up to me

And wraps himself around my knees

And clearly says…

Thank YOU for Channukah.

THAT, right there… is a very

Very humbling thing

To be reminded that

As the imma (mother)

As the woman of the house…

If I don’t find a way

No one does

That if there weren’t…

These efforts made

Even if- God forbid-

robotically…

They are paying into some future

memory…

When our home felt

Warm

When there was

Light here…

And even if it seems like

No one is paying attention

Really

Someone

Is.

I am made small

By the lavishing of love

You have bestowed upon me

I am a complainer

And a self ‘excuser’

And I can always find a reason

‘why.’ I forgot to tap into

Your magnificent love.

There is nothing but it.

I am sorry my eyes grew dim from …

Noticing it.

Thank You for these precious lives

And challenges

Take me back

To the place

Where my heart

First felt love

When not even a moment

Was reality

Without You there….

I want to go back-

But only You can bring me there.

Let these lights…

Guide the way.

October 12, 2021

I wrote this in the hopes that it could help someone out there. Not just someone who is either familiar with addiction, nor someone who is in denial about their addiction… but also to friends and family members who wish their ‘loved one’ could just- get it together! It is a daily battle for some. Others will feel highly skeptical about the solution. But I testify that it can be done. By God’s hand and help.And the support of others who can relate, and the compassion of the sympathetic. **********************

Addiction is convincing yourself that substance or device or vice or emotion is… worth the risk to reach into the alligator’s mouth to obtain.

There it sits, couched in his soft, wet, pink tonguethe deterrent for someone else… not ensnared by the sickness and delusion which is addiction

the razor sharp teeth or the powerful jawsor the aggressive animal instinct that could easily swallow you whole the reflex of terror which can snap in a millisecond

But for the addictyou consider…you devise a plan…you reason the result as being more valuable and worthy than the risk

so you begin to reach, to stretch forth your hand…you delicately caress these pearly razors lying to yourself that they are an adornment making way for the ‘cause’ versus a deterrent you lovingly run your fingers over them bloodying your hands in the process until you can almost… reach your goal

you sense the humid stench of corpses that lie rotting in this reptiles innards but you persist basking in the foul breath as if it were a waft of sweet perfume closer still to the object of your unreasonable need

the addict soaks their hands and forearms in slimy congealed saliva… all to obtain the desire

they climb limb by limb into the patiently awaiting gates of destruction and eagerly approach doom Doom which is of no consequence in the moment

in the distance is heard every reminder calling frantically… every truth beseeching lovingly… every warning… all effort to avoid contact with this predator the addict made in the past… all the people who believe in you… weeping for your survival… every verse… every song… every remedy or inspiration… or beautiful worthwhile uplifting verification you could need to believe: This is dangerous this is temporary this could be fatal this will never define who God make you to be… all call to you… call to you… halfway down the dragon’s throat- muffled, remote, inconsequential… you brush it off like a faintly humming gnat in your ear.

And the addict proceeds. You’re inside, completely- there’s no turning back, you’ve got it there before you and it all seems to fit to be within reach so you indulge- there in the darkness of this hollow cave and suddenly with ferocious clamor the jaws snap shut. Doom. It is certain…

The addict knows this is true. There is no way out, and death is sure, but the addict continues to wallow in the passing pleasure imbibing, consuming, groaning in ecstasy there in the belly of the beast.

Losing oxygen, losing consciousness…slowly but surely departing from vitality.

There is but one Hope- a Champion with a sharpened double edged sword… to come and fight the abomination the only rescue is the decapitation of this Monster. And He can and He will do it for you, the light will come in and He’ll rescue you from the consuming, seemingly inescapable fate… rescue- flinging you from the bile and waste and graveyard leavings.. He’ll clean your wounds out and wash your shame away and attend to the deep scars… that deceived you into first believing it was an explainable excuse to keep tracking, and approaching, and entering this brute attend to the root of the addiction… and give you a mission to control yourself to provide experience that others in danger can relate to… and perhaps be spared from… He will rebuild your life from the ground up, over and over and over again. Relapse and reversal are not the end… they are only a chance for a more meaningful beginning. You can not do it alone. You are not alone.

August 23, 2021

I sat there…sat there and wept at the magnificence of the mercy You lent I cried and prayed…I cried and cried and repented that was yesterday and the next day I turned away the discomfort had been relieved I had no reason to cleave going on about my way that was…that was yesterday so You… You took my breath away brought me right back to a place desperate and lost without You alone…alone I searched for You I…slinking in the shadows peeked into the Garden banquet peeping through the lattice covered completely with the filth of my deeds You noticed me… You noticed me Eyes fixed upon the naked diamond space revealing my gaze at Your Kingly grace I knew I couldn’t run or hide You’d seen me…seen me… now I can’t escape Your eyes … You rise pushing back the chair to walk in my direction into my soul You stare…as You approach my sin sticks in my throat wraps itself around me in shame I choke knees collapse I fall before You fall and fall … I fall before You and as You touch me in that place the blood returns to my purple face for there is life in Your hands and revival in Your embrace You left Your table to remind to remind me my fate is irrevocable because I am Thine forgetting the delicacies and the sweet wine the other prominent guests You’ve left behind we stride in step side by side I am my Beloved’s and my Beloved is mine…

August 17, 2021

my eyes are moist the evidence of Your goodness brought to tears through Your kindness I backslid and begged for help You…didn’t keep me at arms length to show me, to teach me a lesson “Shame, shame!” No, You brought me into Your embrace. You lavished me with favor responding to my fear and request with grace, like a lovers kisses all over my salty tear soaked face the trees breathe as they move the rain water pools reflect the movement of life and spirit these children remind me of how far away I left ‘that place’ who am I today a cacophony of contradiction but every once in a while the noise and discord becomes aligned with Your will in me, Your image Divine and then a sound emerges can’t call it music call it fear of the Lord because it is manifest in this emission from the depths of me its energy is not of this world its like beholding a nation’s banner unfurled no matter the state of the State at that moment the colors, and shape of the history bring forth emotion you have seen the rock spoken to the rock struck the rock again and again and again and yet He still pours forth the proven potion Love Life Hope Devotion…every word that spills forth it moves mountains and man’s heart to change course how many times have I wondered ‘if I never strayed never wandered away…’ would it be between us… this way? Could I possibly comprehend “I need You!” Could I possibly comprehend “…from the trash heap…” You revived an aborted fetus from the refuse and blood of my designs You save, You fashion limitless capacity for running and returning what am I learning born again – it wasn’t just a one time thing so the question is does one have to experience taking upon oneself a contract with death flirting with disaster exposing oneself to the abhorrent in order to experience the Power of witnessing You… beat down the door over turning chairs whipping through the piles and piles of signed pledges “I do…” to addiction “I do…” to distortion “I do…” to depression”I do…” to pride like a storm of a whirlwind You find mine… unfurled is the evidence of my treachery, my lies, every time I chose my glory over Thine… with the same Fingers Who inscribed life for the whole world into stone… You tear to shreds that decree which would ban me from approach… “Mine!” as You scoop me from that den of delusion and we fly back here…to this day as I make these “sounds” from my deepest place my feeble way of saying, ‘Thanks…’for granting my request to again…be returned to this…our unique embrace.

A Poem For Elul…

in the corridor intermission waiting room behind the rope ‘stay in line’ strap I feel like pushing past the barriers and racing through the entry door Heart quickening did I forge anything important? Nothing that’s ‘out there’ ‘back there’ really matters now

Everything I thought I ‘had’ is about to be replaced

elevated

none of it will matter in the same way So, what I come with I have, and what I look like

I’ll be but only until I move on from this Hall of Anticipation and enter into change whose testimony speaks beyond the age I breathe and exhale… I imagine I’m finally let in These in authority of such things be it angels or ‘arms’ of Hashem, I see them smile slyly glancing at my eyes for they well know what I long for why I can scarcely contain my longing for my Beloved

So the ‘stay here’ chain is clicked free and bent before me and its all I can do not to sprint to the door It’s ajar and I burst through Golden sunrise or sunset both at once for although

everything here is defined by the

sacredness of time

nothing about this time here will be reasonable definable or labeled… Golden

warm alive ripe… and endless sea of wheat and dreams You know them all. Where are You? This I’ll ask and although to the naked eye You cannot be seen

the unashamed reality is I’m already dancing in Your arms… ‘Not yet. Slow down. Let’s talk a while, this field is for vision… not yet romance. Let’s discuss the contents of your character

and the essence of your motivation.’ No. I am not taken aback, not disappointed. I well know what being in this field with You means. And also-I know nothing at all. Not yet. I can’t help myself though…I’m lost, captive, to the way these golden beams reflect in the endless pools of Your vision and as You try to explain it to me I am sure I am as naive and simple as a baby

in Your arms. Explain life to an infant? The feeling of closeness and that You’ve taken an interest in this…peasant’s desires? Its not hard to believe

its the only thing worth believing. That You Royal and High designed this meeting. Your maidservant will…I will sprint through that door

with all the angels looking on… I’ll find You

in Timeless Dawn and Sunrise

and there we’ll discuss the things which I brought.

I screamed. I shouted, I beat my breast and tore my garments. I released the roaring lion of betrayal, the tearing claws of resentment, the lashing tongue of denial and guilt…. and became in that place beside him… a processed, ground, raw, bloodied piece of flesh. Open to parts of myself I didn’t even realize I had. I’d been patching over with linen strips, soaked with the stench of decay and infection. These bandages all fell away when he breathed on me… and there I was. An open wound. Oozing in his hands. He kissed me with shimmering lips, brushed by the dew of heaven, the pure oil of joy, the salve of comfort. He kissed every single throbbing inch of me, soothing my pain… cauterizing my doubtfulness… sealing his promises with the kind of love that grants true healing. Healing that causes my open flesh to become a scar. A thick and complex layered tablet… upon which he now can surely, precisely, accurately and definitively etch his purposes upon. I receive him as he is and he took me as I was… and no doubt or pain or distortion can separate that which the king in glory has cast together. He took me from a sloppy, putrid, heel dragging dust inhaling disaster… and gave me royal garments he himself removed, from his own precious self… to be naked and abused, he clothed me in his glorious robes. He pressed a cool delectable swig of wine from the finest goblet… to my trembling salty tear soaked lips … while he tasted spittle and grime flung as if he were dung, while I drank to fill… he was emptied. He washed my feet, drizzling the finest perfumed fingertips gently around my toes… while he, hanging, throbbing in pain, encrusted with dry blood, leaving trails well worn for the fresh crimson to spill forth… he bled for my anointment. To waste this life, to say it is worthless… renders his sacrifice as filth. God forbid! I was worth his very life. So I will dance through the streets of Jerusalem now, I will fling dust into the air because I cannot cease from the joy of this magnificent purchase. To remember because of Him.

What does it mean to be holy? Kedusha – holiness is often misunderstood. There is a notion that holiness means to be totally disconnected from mundane reality; that it is sacred and something completely elevated. When we think of holy imagery we may imagine a monk sitting on the mountain top meditating and speaking gently, or someone else who stands detached from the day-to-day grind of work, computers and technology, changing diapers and cooking.

Nothing could be further from the truth. To truly be holy means to be fully and passionately connected and identified with our inner self, while at the same having the capacity to express that through our day-to-day life.

The opposite of the word kodesh – holy, is the word chol – mundane. Interestingly, chol is also the same Hebrew word for sand. Why? Sand is unique from dirt in that no matter how much water you use to make the pieces stick, they ultimately remain separate entities and never really connect or join together. To be mundane means to be disconnected from our true purpose and meaning in life. The opposite is holiness which ultimately is the passionate connection to our soul, God and the pervasive purpose that exists within the fabric of creation.

On Yom Kippur, we temporarily leave the world behind and elevate our body to the place of our soul. We stop engaging in the material world by refraining from wearing comfortable shoes, showering, eating or drinking and spend the majority of the day in spiritual pursuits. Though we may see this as the holiest of holidays – the word choice of God in the Torah is tahara (see Leviticus 16:30) which means cleansing and healing.

Sukkot gives us the opportunity to connect our lives with true depth, beauty and meaning.

But on Sukkot, we don’t bring our body up to our soul, rather we bring our newly cleansed and clarified soul and vision back down into our body. We are meant to ask ourselves the question: “Now that I went through the ten days of repentance, how can I bring that down into my day to day life – to live as an expression of my deepest self?” The answer to that question is in the Sukkah.

The sukkah is a place where everything we do from eating and drinking to sleeping and shmoozing becomes elevated and sanctified because it’s being done within the context of a mitzvah, a divine commandment. The mitzvah of living in the sukkah affords us the opportunity to see what life would be like if everything we did was connected with true depth, beauty and meaning.

The Torah teaches us that to truly be a holy person, we need not run away from the world and up towards the soul, rather we must grab the world with all of its glory, identify and fill it with the majesty of our own unique divinity. This Sukkot, let us take the time to remember how high we reached on Yom Kippur and find many ways to channel those moments into our day to day lives and elevate even the little things.
